16in circular needle or one size larger than needle for gauge �1 this simple cozy cowl makes the most of fabulously dyed fingering weight yarn it is completely reversible and surprisingly easy to knit use caterpillargreen yarns blue light colourway which can be divided into two skeins for coordinated colour perfection or choose your own adventure with two colours of any fingering weight yarn abbreviations yfsl1yo slipped stitch pair on knit row bring yarn to front slip 1 stitch purl-wise bring yarn to back over the right needle to create a yarnover that is paired with a slipped stitch sl1yofslipped stitch pair on purl row with yarn to front slip 1 stitch purl-wise bring yarn to back over the right needle to create a yarnover that is paired with a slipped stitch bring yarn to front again k2tog knit two stitches together in brioche the two stitches are the paired slipped stitch and yarnover from the previous round p2tog purl two stitches together in brioche the two stitches are the paired slipped stitch and yarnover from the previous round pattern instructions if you are using caterpillargreen mcn fingering in blue light divide into two even balls along the transition between colour sections gradient and stripes mc will be the gradient cc will be the stripes if using a different yarn choose which colour will be mc and cc using larger needle and mc use the long-tail method to cast on 126sts switch to smaller needle join in the round taking care not to twist place marker for beginning of round and work setup row *k1 yfsl1yo* repeat to end drop mc yarn to back of work brioche row 1 with cc *sl1yof p2tog* to end drop cc yarn to back of work when picking up mc yarn for next round make sure it comes out below cc yarn in last stitch and that the two yarns are not twisted around each other the same applies when picking up cc yarn again brioche row 2 with mc *k2tog yfsl1yo* to end repeat brioche row 1 and 2 until 6m/6 5yd of one colour of yarn remain or cowl has reached desired height break other yarn leaving 20cm 8in tail for weaving in if using mc to bind off *k2tog p1* to end if using cc to bind off *k1 p2tog* to end using larger needle bind off loosely weave
